Title: A field study of API learning obstacles
Conference: (2011) Empir Software Eng 16, 703–732

Title: A Metrics-Based Approach to Technical Documentation Quality
Conference: 2010 Seventh International Conference on the Quality of Information and Communications Technology
Summary:
Tested technical documentation quality by checking for uniqueness of information and test coverage. 
Both are done automatically however, test coverage is combined with test results which are done manually by asking people to find documentation to do a task. 
But is something like 49% non uniqueness bad?

Title: A Study of the Documentation Essential to Software Maintenance
Conference: SIGDOC '05: Proceedings of the 23rd annual international conference on Design of communication: documenting & designing for pervasive information
Summary:
Most important artifacts are source code and comments, a data model, and information about the requirements.
Documentation is generally incomplete and out-of-date

Title: Cost, benefits and quality of software development documentation: A systematic mapping
Conference: (2014). Cost, Benefits and Quality of Software Development Documentation: A Systematic Mapping. Journal of Systems and Software
Summary: Accessibility, Consistency, Duplication, Readability, Spelling and Grammar, Trustworthiness, Author-related, Correctness (Accuracy), Information Completeness, Similarity, Traceability, Up-to-datedness

Title: Evaluating Usage and Quality of Technical Software Documentation: An Empirical Study
Conference: EASE '13: Proceedings of the 17th International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering
Summary: Up-to-datedness is not actually that important. More important is organization, relevency, readability, and visual model aids

Title: How API Documentation Fails
Conference: July-Aug. 2015, "How API Documentation Fails," in IEEE Software, vol. 32, no. 4, pp. 68-75
Summary:
Ambiguity, Incompleteness, and Incorrectness are the top 3 that should be fixed.
Novice and Experienced responders have no statistically significant difference in thoughts.
Most frequent and common problems deal with Content rather than presentation
Completing, clarifying, and correcting documentation requires deep, authoritative knowledge of the API. -> Hard for new/non developers to contribute

Title: Software Architecture Documentation in Practice: Documenting Architectural Layers
Conference: (2000). Software Architecture Documentation in Practice: Documenting Architectural Layers
Summary:
Documentation should be written from the point of view of the reader, not the writer. 
Avoid repetition
Avoid unintentional ambiguity
Use a standard organization
Record rationale
Keep it current
Review documentation for fitness of purpose

Title: Software Documentation - Building and Maintaining Artefacts of Communication
Conference: 2002 Presented to the Faculty of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree Master in Computer Science
Summary:
Being up to date in documentation is not that useful of a metric
Documentation is tool of communication rather than tool of fact

Title: Software Documentation Issues Unveiled
Conference: 2019 IEEE/ACM 41st International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE)
Summary: 4 main documentation problems categories: "What", "How", process-related, tool-related

Title: The Relevance of Software Documentation, Tools and Technologies: A Survey
Conference: DocEng '02: Proceedings of the 2002 ACM symposium on Document engineering
Summary:
Content, up-to-dateness, availability, use of examples, and organization are what is perceived to be what is important for documentation.
Suggests documentation that is light and disposable as it is too hard to maintain documentation

Title: Understanding the Requirements for Information System Documentation: An Empirical Investigation
Conference: COCS '95: Proceedings of conference on Organizational computing systems
Summary:
8 hypotheses/requirements for good documentation:
Backbone systems require more formal documentation process than non-backbone systems
Backbone systems require documents with a high degree of traceability
Out-of-house development/maintenance efforts undergo documentation processes that are more formal than those of in-house
Out-of-house developments require a high degree of traceability
In-house developments can accommodate low consistency and completeness but require accurate details
In-house development efforts require less documentation that those of out-of-house development efforts 
Users unfamiliar with similar automated systems follow a different documentation process than familiar users
Users unfamiliar with similar automated systems require documents that are more consistent, complete, and traceable

Title: Usage and usefulness of technical software documentation: An industrial case study
Conference:
Usage and usefulness of technical software documentation: An industrial case study,
Information and Software Technology,
Volume 57,
2015
Summary:
Significant different between documentation and other sources of information during different phases of software cycle
No significant difference in documentation usage in different phases of software cycle
No significant difference on job function on amount of documentation usage
No significant difference on job experience and documentation usage
No significant different on job experience on type of documtentation used

Title: Detecting API documentation errors
Conference: OOPSLA '13: Proceedings of the 2013 ACM SIGPLAN international conference on Object oriented programming systems languages & applications
Summary: Created a program that found documentation errors and reported >1000 errors to 5 API libraries

Title: API documentation and software community values: a survey of open-source API documentation
Conference: SIGDOC '13: Proceedings of the 31st ACM international conference on Design of communication
Summary:
Summarized what other papers said what was useful to have in terms of documentation
Overview documentation
Short code "snippets" that demonstrate usage of API in context
Code examples that show best practices with API
Scenario and task-based documentation
Limitations and error handling
Meaningful documentation (no filler or boilerplate)
Accuracy, completeness, correctness
Scenario and task-focused examples
Content that does not repeat the obvious (eg can be learned from ui)

Title: Opiner: An Opinion Search and SummarizationEngine for APIs
Conference: 2017 32nd IEEE/ACM International Conference on Automated Software Engineering (ASE)
Summary: Developed a tool that would search and provide (summarized or original) opinions about an API

Title: A Visualization-based Approach to Present and Assess Technical Documentation Quality
Conference: (2010) Proceedings of the 4th European Conference on Information Management and Evaluation
Summary: Checked documentation quality based on "Clone detection", "Usage analysis", "Structure analysis", "Meta-information analysis"

Title: Evaluating the Quality of the Documentation of Open Source Software
Conference: ENASE 2017
Summary: Defined another set of metrics based on metrics defined by previous works and created a calculation for their metrics

Title: Analyzing APIs Documentation and Code to Detect Directive Defects
Conference: 2017 IEEE/ACM 39th International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE)
Summary: Found discrepancies between API documentation and source code with a combination of static code analysis and NLP

Title: An empirical analysis of the impact of software development problem factors on software maintainability
Conference:
Journal of Systems and Software
Volume 82, Issue 6, June 2009
Summary:
Inadequacy or poorness of documentation which would cause software to be hard to understand, change and modify
Documentation is obscure or untrustworthy
Inadequate system documentation; incomplete or non-existent system documentation
Changes are not adequately documented
Lack of integrity/consistency

Title: What Makes APIs Hard to Learn? Answers from Developers
Conference: (2009) IEEE Software, vol. 26, no. 6, pp. 27-34, Nov.-Dec.
Summary:
API documentation must include good examples, be complete, support many complex usage scenarios, be conveniently organized, and include relevant design elements
Respondents also expressed the feeling of wanting to know the design intent behind the API

Title: The Value of Software Documentation Quality
Conference: 2014 14th International Conference on Quality Software
Summary: The most important quality attributes with regard to documentation quality are accuracy, clarity, consistency, readability, structuredness, and understandability

Title: A Topic Modeling Based Solution for Confirming Software Documentation Quality
Conference: (2016). A Topic Modeling Based Solution for Confirming Software Documentation Quality. International Journal of Advanced Computer Science and Applications
Summary: Combined Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) and Hellinger distance to rate the relatedness of source code and documentation based on similarity. High similarity = High quality?

Title: A Study of the Effectiveness of Usage Examples in REST API Documentation
Conference: 2017 IEEE Symposium on Visual Languages and Human-Centric Computing (VL/HCC)
Summary: Concluded that usage examples in API documentation reduce time spent, and number of trial attempts, while raising success rate of task implementation for developers.
